snippet: Laws being challenged in Florida and Alabama are only more proof of the moral disgrace of capital punishment in this country.
abstract: Editorial examines legal challenges to elements of death penalty laws in Alabama and Florida, noting latter will receive Supreme Court review; observes Florida's laws do not require a unanimous jury for a death sentence, and Alabama affords extraordinary discretionary power to judges; argues that such state laws only add to moral disgrace of capital punishment, which should be abolished at federal level.
lead_paragraph: Laws being challenged in Florida and Alabama are only more proof of the moral disgrace of capital punishment in this country.

headline.print_headline: Death Sentences, With or Without a Jury
